messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

Generate a world_state JSON from this scenario:

{
  "scenario_id": "scenario_noise05_depth05",
  "description": "Planning meeting scenario with moderate noise and moderate indirectness (noise=0.5, depth=0.5)",
  "noise_level": 0.5,
  "depth": 0.5,
  "global_settings": {
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "workday_start": "09:00",
    "workday_end": "18:00"
  },
  "org_units": [
    "Engineering",
    "Product"
  ],
  "people": [
    {
      "id": "person_alex_smith",
      "name": "Alex Smith",
      "email": "alex.smith@company.com",
      "team": "Engineering",
      "role": "PM"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_jordan_johnson",
      "name": "Jordan Johnson",
      "email": "jordan.johnson@company.com",
      "team": "Product",
      "role": "Engineer"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_sam_williams",
      "name": "Sam Williams",
      "email": "sam.williams@company.com",
      "team": "Engineering",
      "role": "Engineer"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_taylor_brown",
      "name": "Taylor Brown",
      "email": "taylor.brown@company.com",
      "team": "Product",
      "role": "Designer"
    }
  ],
  "projects": [
    {
      "id": "project_main",
      "name": "Main Product",
      "type": "software_development",
      "status": "active"
    }
  ],
  "sub_scenarios": [
    {
      "id": "planning_meeting_1",
      "type": "planning_meeting",
      "abstract_description": "Team planning meeting to discuss project progress and next steps",
      "participants_hint": [
        "Alex Smith",
        "Jordan Johnson",
        "Sam Williams"
      ],
      "constraints_hint": "Meeting should be scheduled for next week, during working hours (09:00-18:00), with a duration of 45 minutes. All participants must be available."
    }
  ]
}

Remember:
- noise_level=0.5: Generate moderate noise
- depth=0.5: Make evidence moderately indirect

Output the complete world_state JSON now.

raw_message.content:

        "latest_end": "2025-12-05T18:00:00-05:00"
      },
      "final_meeting_details": {
        "title": "Main Product – Sprint Planning & Next Steps",
        "description": "Planning session to review current Main Product progress, clarify blockers, and plan next sprint work.",
        "organizer": "person_alex_smith",
        "participants": [
          "person_alex_smith",
          "person_jordan_johnson",
          "person_sam_williams"
        ],
        "start_time": "2025-12-03T10:30:00-05:00",
        "end_time": "2025-12-03T11:15:00-05:00",
        "location": "Zoom",
        "calendar_event_id": "cal_evt_main_planning_20251203_1030",
        "conference_link": "https://zoom.us/j/9786543210?pwd=main-product-planning",
        "status": "confirmed"
      },
      "events": [
        {
          "id": "evt_1_slack_initial_ping",
          "type": "slack_message",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T15:05:12-05:00",
          "channel": "proj-main-product",
          "from": "person_alex_smith",
          "to": [
            "person_jordan_johnson",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "text": "Hey @Jordan @Sam, we should get a planning session on the calendar for next week to sync on Main Product progress and next steps. I’m thinking 45 mins some time between Mon–Wed during the day. Any major conflicts I should avoid?",
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "evt_2_email_calendar_hold",
          "type": "email",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T15:22:47-05:00",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [

            "sam.williams@company.com"
          ],
          "cc": [],

          "attachments": [],
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {

              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_jordan_johnson",
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "start_time": "2025-12-03T10:30:00-05:00",
            "end_time": "2025-12-03T11:15:00-05:00",
            "location": "Zoom",
            "conference_link": "https://zoom.us/j/9786543210?pwd=main-product-planning",
            "status": "tentative"
          },
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "evt_4_slack_availability_jordan",
          "type": "slack_message",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T16:02:31-05:00",
          "channel": "proj-main-product",
          "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
          "to": [
            "person_alex_smith"
          ],
          "text": "That Wed 12/3 10:30–11:15 ET hold works for me. I’m in another standup right before but should be free at 10:30.",
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "evt_5_slack_availability_sam",
          "type": "slack_message",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T16:18:09-05:00",
          "channel": "proj-main-product",
          "from": "person_sam_williams",
          "to": [
            "person_alex_smith",
            "person_jordan_johnson"
          ],
          "text": "Works for me as well. I’ve got code freeze tasks that afternoon, so earlier in the day is perfect.",
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "evt_6_calendar_event_status_update",
          "type": "calendar_event_updated",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T16:35:42-05:00",
          "editor": "person_alex_smith",

            "end_time": "2025-12-03T11:15:00-05:00"
          },

            "title": "Main Product – Sprint Planning & Next Steps",
            "status": "confirmed",
            "start_time": "2025-12-03T10:30:00-05:00",
            "end_time": "2025-12-03T11:15:00-05:00"
          },
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "evt_7_email_agenda_followup",
          "type": "email",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-26T09:12:18-05:00",
          "from": "alex.smith@company.com",
          "to": [
            "jordan.johnson@company.com",
            "sam.williams@company.com"
          ],
          "subject": "Agenda: Main Product – Sprint Planning & Next Steps (Wed 12/3, 10:30–11:15 ET)",
          "body": "Hi both,\n\nThanks for confirming the time. Our planning session is set for **Wed, Dec 3 from 10:30–11:15am ET** (Zoom link in the invite).\n\nProposed agenda:\n1) Quick status check on current Main Product work\n2) Review of open bugs / tech debt\n3) Next sprint priorities and owners\n\nIf there’s anything else you want to cover, reply here and I’ll add it.\n\nBest,\nAlex",
          "attachments": [],
          "related_project": "project_main"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "noise_scenarios": [
    {

        }
      ]
    },

        "person_jordan_johnson"
      ],

          ],

        },
        {
          "id": "noise3_evt_2_email_manager",
          "type": "email",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T10:19:34-05:00",

          "to": [

          ],

          "attachments": []
        }
      ]
    },
    {

          "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
          "to": [
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "text": "Sam, can you take a look at BUG-4312? It’s affecting signups in Safari only. Might be worth squeezing into this sprint if it’s low lift.",
          "related_project": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "noise4_evt_2_slack_reply",
          "type": "slack_message",
          "timestamp": "2025-11-25T14:41:02-05:00",
          "channel": "bugs-main-product",
          "from": "person_sam_williams",
          "to": [
            "person_jordan_johnson"
          ],
          "text": "Yeah, I’ll dig into it this afternoon. If it’s a simple CSS/JS quirk I can patch it today, otherwise I’ll propose it for the next sprint.",
          "related_project": "project_main"

      ]
    },
    {
      "id": "noise_5_random_calendar_block",

      "seed": 66102,

        "person_alex_smith"
      ],
